physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 6 weeks, presented with hypocalcemic seizures; calcium level: 1.32 mmol/liter; magnesium level: 0.48 mmol/liter. At 4 years, renal ultrasound showed early nephrocalcinosis. At 12 years, the other sibling had macroscopic hematuria and flank pain with dense nephrocalcinosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Calcium and magnesium levels improved with supplementation. Initially, one sibling had hypocalcemic seizures; later on, they confirmed bilateral nephrocalcinosis.
